docs.lead_paragraph: ALBANY, May 18 The State Assembly approved with surprisingly little dissent today a bill that would encourage physicians to prescribe drugs by generic rather than brand name. The bill would require physicians to include the generic name of the drug on every prescription they write, but would allow them to specify a brand if they felt it was necessary.

headline.main: GENERIC-DRUGS LAW IS BACKED IN ALBANY; Assembly Votes to Foster Writing of Lower-Cost Prescriptions GENERIC-DRUGS BILL PASSED BY ASSEMBLY

byline.original: By RICHARD J. MEISLIN Special to The New York Times

docs.lead_paragraph: ALBANY, May 18 The State Assembly approved with surprisingly little dissent today a bill that would encourage physicians to prescribe drugs by generic rather than brand name. The bill would require physicians to include the generic name of the drug on every prescription they write, but would allow them to specify a brand if they felt it was necessary.

headline.main: GENERIC-DRUGS LAW IS BACKED IN ALBANY; Assembly Votes to Foster Writing of Lower-Cost Prescriptions GENERIC-DRUGS BILL PASSED By ASSEMBLY

docs.abstract: Bill to require drs to prescribe drugs by generic names, and add brand names optionally, approved by NYS Assembly, 135-6; milder Sen version would permit dr to allow pharmacist to substitute generic drug; drug indus opposition to Assembly measure revd (M)
docs.snippet: ALBANY, May 18 The State Assembly approved with surprisingly little dissent today a bill that would encourage physicians to prescribe drugs by generic rather than brand name. The bill would require physicians to include the generic name of the drug...

byline.original: By RICHARD J. MEISLIN Special to The New York Times

docs.lead_paragraph: "DRUG TOPICS" of last Feb. 15 had a full-page advertisement on its inside cover offering the medication Chlordiazepoxide under "another brand name" at "40% less" than it cost under its original brand name.
docs.abstract: Morris Forer article on bill introduced by NJ Assemblyman Martin A Herman that would set up council which would compose formulary listing of brand-name drugs under chem or generic names; such meds could be interchanged with brand name drugs (M)
